titleStmt.title: Cheat upon cheat, or, The debaucht hypocrite. Being a true account oftwo [sic] maidens, who lived in London near Fish-street, the one being named Susan, the othes [sic] Sarah. Susan, being dressed in mans apparel, courted Sarah, to the great trouble of the deceived damsel, who thought to be pleasur'd by her bridals [sic] nights [sic] lodging as you may find by the sequel. When maidens come to love and ... and want the use of man, against their wills they needs must shew't let them do what they can. To the tunof [sic], Tender hearts of London city.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for, I[osiah]. Blare, at the Looking-Glass in the New-Buildings on London-Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Come and hear the strangest story ..."
Place, date of publication, and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.

place.placeName: the Looking-Glass in the New-Buildings on London-Bridge.
